page.title: 13NEW FARM, TOOT BALDON
page.content: Ernie and Annie Greenaway rent 68 acres from Oxfordshire County Council. He buys calves to fatten up to sell as beef-cattle. His real interest is 5 horses which his youngest son rides successfully in competitions. He is semi-retired having sold his milk herd. His day starts at 7.30 a.m.. After putting the cows in with the calves, he breakfasts, then feeds the horses and mucks out. Ernie also rents 29 acres for grazing. The house was built in 1928 and they have been there for 22 years. The land farmed by Ernie and Mr. Brook was acquired from Queens College for the returning servicemen of the First World War. Originally it was divided into 5 parts. The Greenaways are an old Marsh Baldon family. Ernie was one of 8 children, all involved in farming.
